utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, ladies of the Castle household. Just a reminder that your portion for the holiday poem is due in less than 72 hours.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I just have to do a polish.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t wait to see it. How’s yours coming along? Are you ready for your big debut in the Castle family Christmas card?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is going to be the best year ever!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so excited!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, I completely forgot. He said that it wasn’t a big deal, but I think it actually kind of is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s a very big deal. We even get a little competitive.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I started working on mine in July.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wha-?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Welcome to the family.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do I have to do again?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Write six, funny, poignant, eloquent lines describing highlights of the past year. For you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And they must rhyme.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What word rhymes with “I’m screwed”?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just that rhyming isn’t exactly my thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This coming from a woman who skipped prom to crash a poetry slam.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Spoken word, Castle. That’s a totally different jam. I mean, I could write a haiku for you instead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, that’s against the rules.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when do you follow rules?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since I’m the one who made them. You should probably get me your first draft by the time we get to the precinct holiday party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s two days away!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? Plenty of time.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So get ready for a murder with a little holiday spirit. It went down around 10:30PM. Witnesses saw a black Mustang, no plates, chasing after this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This was a drive by? I mean, it looks like he was shot close range.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and the shooter capped him in the head to finish him off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this wasn’t random. Did anyone get a good look at the assailant?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, when he drove by like a bat out of hell. Fuzzy red hat, big white beard?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously? Our killer is Santa Claus?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Three witnesses all told the same story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys. Squeezing down countless chimneys, delivering millions of presents in one night? It’s bound to happen. Santa finally cracked.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or … our victim was naughty instead of nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was tasteless.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or our killer just wore a Santa suit because that was the prefect disguise at this time of year. So, what do we know about the victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His name is Eric Mercer. Lives in Midtown. His hospital ID says he’s an ER doctor at St. Simon's.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know where he was coming from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, but he bought a latte at a coffee shop six blocks away from here before our gun-toting St. Nick came after him. And the barista there said that Mercer was carrying a blue backpack. But witnesses who saw Mercer running said there wasn’t any backpack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s set up a search from here to that coffee shop. That backpack may contain clues as to why he was killed.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Or maybe the last person that Mercer talked to can shed some light on that. Ten minutes before he was shot Eric Mercer called someone at St. Simon's Hospital.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did he seem when you talked?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: A little on edge, I guess. Like he was in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he say why?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: I assume it was his uncle. His uncle has cancer and lives alone. Eric tried to be there for him. He missed work last night, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know his name?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Edward, I think. Edward Mercer. Maybe he knows why this happened to Eric.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’chu got for me, girl?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I found these on the arm of the vic’s jacket. Some kind of tiny crystals.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could they be from the Christmas decorations he landed on after he crashed through the window?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, these are mineral crystals. Hopefully the lab can ID them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hang on. You always call me down here after the lab results are in, which leads me to believe that you may have some ulterior motives.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi, I want to ask a little favor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anything you need.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So … my parents barely ever leave Louisiana and they’re flying out to Paris tomorrow and they have a last minute layover in New York. They want us all to get together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So it’s … uh … meet the parents?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are you okay with that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. Why wouldn’t I be? That’s not even really a favor. That’s just me … stepping up.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See, I didn’t get to the favor part. Yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You didn’t?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See, um… my parents … my parents kind of think we’re engaged.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why do they think that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, you and I were on again, off again. They just got so worried about their unmarried daughter –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you told them we got engaged?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I didn’t mean too. I just … popped out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now how does something like that just pop out?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I wanted them to stop bugging me. I’m sorry, Javi, but once I said it there it was and now here they are.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So the first time I meet your parents, you’re asking me to lie to them?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ll be lying to them, too. But I’ve been doing it longer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Can I just bring them down to the precinct to say hello and you could just pretend for just ten minutes. I’ll make it worth your while.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. I can do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we looked into Eric’s family history, contacts in his phone and computer. And he doesn’t have an uncle named Edward Mercer. In fact, he doesn’t have an uncle at all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did he miss his shift and where did he go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I may have an answer to that. It turns out that Eric used the Hitch ride-share app to catch a ride to an address in Queens tonight, a couple of hours before he was killed. In fact, he took numerous trips to that same address, which line up with shifts that he missed at the hospital.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what’s at this location?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Certainly not Uncle Edward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Offices. It’s an office building owned by Evergreen Sanitation NYC.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Evergreen Sanitation NYC is a known front for organized crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Eric Mercer be visiting a mob owned building?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s head to Queens and find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No placards, no names. It’s like this whole place is unoccupied.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet, Eric missed work to come here. Repeatedly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh! Excuse me. Sir? NYPD. Could you help –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, sir! Could you please just help us? We …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. This is a surgical suite.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Owned by organized crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eric wasn’t just a doctor. He was a mob doctor.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE MCBRIDE
utterance.content: I’ve worked with organized crime for 16 years and know most of the players. But this guy? No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we believe he may have been the family doctor for whoever controls Evergreen Sanitation NYC.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the Carlucci family. They’ve been moving up the charts since Dino Scarpella took over. But I didn’t know that they had a doctor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Um … Dino Scarpella? I know that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. He helped me with research for a Derrick Storm novel. But back then he was just a mid-level guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective McBride, if Eric was a doctor for the Carlucci family, do you have any idea why he would have been targeted?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: I haven’t heard anything, if that’s what you’re asking me. But um… the way he was killed sounds like somebody was sending a message.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where would we find Dino Scarpella?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: His main offices are over in Queens. It’s a strip club called Chica Chica Boom Room. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we should go talk to him. Dino knows me. He likes me. If Eric was his mob doctor he’d want to help solve this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Assuming he wasn’t involved. You know, I’ll have Detectives Ryan and Esposito coordinate with you on the Mustang and ballistics. We’ll see if any of that connects to anyone in organized crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Field trip to a strip club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you keep staring like that, you’re going to have to pay for the two drink minimum.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what where you saying?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wasn’t saying anything. You were talking about Dino, about how he’s a nice guy in spite of the fact that he’s a mobster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No … I know you find this hard to believe, but he is a really nice guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Up until the point he guts you like a fish.

utterance.speaker: DINO SCARPELLA
utterance.content: Rick. Is that really you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino!

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Oh, man. You know I just finished your book, Raging Heat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Terrific. Wonderful story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Wonderful. Yeah. So what brings you here? And who is this Venus?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, this is my wife, Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, she’s okay. I’m actually consulting with the police now. And we’re here for your help in a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: For you, Rick? I’m happy to help. And the boys are too. Rocco Carlucci, he’s my … my chief of security. And this is Christopher Carlucci. VP of corporate affairs.

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER CARLUCCI
utterance.content: Who got whacked?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A doctor. Eric Mercer.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Um … I do not recognize this person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Scarpella, we’ve connected Dr. Mercer to a surgical suite paid for by your organization.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, we know Eric worked for you, but who would want to do this to him? Can you help us out?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Sadly, I have no help to offer. But please, stay. Enjoy yourselves. It’s on the house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Scarpella …

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: Like he said. We’ve got nothing for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So while you and Castle were busy getting lap dances, Ryan and I did some real police work. We found a Carlucci connection to the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what kind of a connection?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, it turns out the family’s number two, Christopher Carlucci, owns a black Mustang. Guess what was stashed inside? A Santa suit. With blood on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Christopher Carlucci? We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you kill Eric Mercer?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then why don’t you clear this up for me? Where were you at the time of the murder? And why did witnesses see your Mustang at the crime scene? And why did we find a Santa suit stuffed in the trunk of your car with Eric’s blood on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Christopher, I don’t think you just woke up one morning and decided to kill the family doctor. That kind of order comes from above. Did Dino Scarpella give the order?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I wonder why the Carluccis would kill their own doctor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he saw something he shouldn’t have? Let the wrong mobster die on his table?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Rick. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He said he wanted you to meet him at the strip club? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He just said that it was urgent. And when Dino Scarpella issues an invitation you don’t RSVP with no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you do. Especially if he put a hit out on Eric Mercer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, he called me at the precinct. He knows I’m married to you. I’m in no danger here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, Castle. This just sounds like an epitaph. Um … you know what? I’m going to go with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He said to come alone. You’re going to have to trust me on this. Dino … he’s an honorable man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I bet that’s what Eric thought, too.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Buy yourself something nice, okay sweetheart? Take your mind off this tragedy. And don’t tell your mother, okay?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Thanks, Daddy.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Jane. The roll of cash she spends on clothes could choke a horse. I even bought an imitation couture company, but the fake stuff isn’t good enough for my girl, right? Plus, you know, she’s upset about Eric. They were very close. Very close. Since they were kids.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re admitting he was your doctor?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I don’t like that word, admit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Acknowledging?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Oh, Rick. Me and you, we had a good relationship once, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We still do, don’t we?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I don’t know. I need to know I can speak freely. That you’re not going to turn around and repeat what I say to the authorities.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, you can trust me.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Eric was family. My cousin Bruno’s kid. By a girl he had on the side. Bruno, he died in the slammer, so I looked after Eric. I sent him to the best schools. I didn’t want him to work for the family, but you want to hear God laugh, you tell him – you tell him all your plans, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: A few years back, one of my guys got shot. It happens. He would have croaked, but Eric stepped up. Next thing I know – next thing I know he’s got a taste for the life. I need to find out who did this to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t take this the wrong way, but I think you already do know.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: It was not Christopher.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All the evidence says that it was.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: He was framed. He’s innocent. When it comes to this, anyway. I know because I was with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, if that’s true all we have to do is call Beckett. You can alibi him.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: No, that’s no good. See, at the time me and Christopher, we were engaged in a sensitive business transaction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And by sensitive you mean illegal.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I don’t like that word, either. My point is this: the cops are not looking for Eric’s killer because they think they’ve already got him. Even if they are out looking for him, nobody in my world’s going to give them the time of day. And this is where you come in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Yeah. I need you to prove Christopher’s innocence and find Eric’s killer. Hey, nobody connected is going to talk to the cops. But if I vouch for you it’ll give you access no cop has ever gotten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, I don’t know if I’m the guy –

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I could crack a joke about making you an offer you can’t refuse. But you cannot refuse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Understood.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if I figure out who did this, you have to let me bring the killer to justice. And by justice I mean legal justice. Not just taking him out when the time comes. I need to call Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: We will swear by the code of silence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Omertà?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: You’re blood now, Rick. You’re family. Do not let me down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So let me get this straight. You want to reinvestigate Eric’s murder on behalf of your friend, Dino the mob boss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, when you put it like that it sounds bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It sounds bad no matter how I put it. Castle, we have the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Christopher was with Dino at the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to Dino. Dino is playing you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mobsters get arrested. It’s a cost of doing business. Dino knows that. So why go through the trouble of asking me to look into it unless Christopher was innocent?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Firstly, he didn’t exactly ask you. Secondly, he just wants his number two back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s more to it than that. Omertà. We made the blood oath. It was not my idea and I did not have a choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you believe Dino because he gave you a paper cut?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, if I look into Eric’s murder and the trail leads back to Christopher Carlucci, so be it. But if it doesn’t … don’t you want to know who the real killer is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But you have to promise that Captain Gates isn’t going to find out that we’re poking around an already closed case. And you have to keep me looped in every step of that way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I promise. And since Dino gave me an all-access pass to with family, I’m going to start with talking to Christopher.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I heard Dino Scarpella and Castle had a sit-down. What do you think that’s about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. But I don’t like him going around us like this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey, baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javier, these are my parents, Walter and Melinda.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: WALTER PARISH
utterance.content: We’re huggers in the Parish family, son. And go ahead. Call me Dad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I can see where Lanie gets her beautiful eyes from. And her medical brain must come from you. I hear you’re a surgeon?

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: Cardiothoracic. But retired.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA PARISH
utterance.content: No shop talk, dear. The only talk I want is to hear the story.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What story?

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: The proposal, of course!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh! That story. Right. Javi?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, the story. Um … well, we … um … you know, baby, you tell it so much better than me. Why don’t you –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy! You should have seen him. He rows Lanie out into the middle of the Central Park boat pond. He gets down on one knee, so nervous he nearly capsizes the boat. Almost sends them both into the water.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s just what Lanie did when – – she saw that ring. Ugh. Perfect fit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m Kevin, by the way. Espo’s partner and proposal planner in crime.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: That’s so romantic. I want to hear all about the courtship.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I just wish we had time for all of that, but you know, with us having to get back to work and you having to catch your plane –

utterance.speaker: WALTER
utterance.content: Actually, I just got a text that our flight’s been delayed til tomorrow. So why don’t we all go out and have dinner a little later?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, that sounds … great, Walter. I mean … Dad.

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: You sure he’s good? Ask your questions. I’ll tell you what I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Dino says you were set up. So who would want to frame you?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: I’m his right hand man. I know fifty who would slit my throat like that. But they’d kill me. Not one of them would frame me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then let’s talk about Eric.

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: Eric … uh … recently had some concerns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Concerns that someone was after him?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: Not exactly. See, Eric, being our doctor, we kept that secret. So he could have a life outside the family. But I guess he was afraid that his secret got out. Because a few days ago, he comes to me and he asks a favor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of favor?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: He wanted phone tap detectors. You know, tracing equipment. He thought he was being watched.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By whom?

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: I don’t know. At the time I thought he was just being paranoid. But I wanted to be safe, so I uh, I hooked him up with Cyber Rita.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Are you morons ready? I’m cutting the alarm in three – two – one. Bam. Yeah, I helped the doc.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, did Eric tell you who he thought was watching him?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When he asked for the counter-surveillance equipment.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: That’s not what he asked me for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It isn’t?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: No. Christopher called me and told me to give Eric whatever he needed. So I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did Eric need?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Well, it sounds like Eric told Christopher one thing and me another. So I’m not going to say another word until I’m sure that Lurch over there isn’t going to have me sleeping with the fishes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Lurch, would you – – Rocco, I mean, could you - ?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: He wanted hot credit cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stolen credit cards? What for?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: So he could buy things and not have to pay for them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, that’s –

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I gave him a dozen, so each is good for about two grand before it needs to be tossed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Eric say why he needed twenty four thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Maybe for wheels? He asked if he could use the card to access a swipe and go car rental, but I told him he was definitely going to need a fake ID to go with the card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Could you email me those credit card numbers so I can see if he used them?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Yeah. Which of you idiots just triggered the security door?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stolen credit cards? A possible getaway car? It sounds like Eric was about to go on the run.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only the killer got to him first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so if Christopher didn’t kill him, then who did?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe whatever Eric was charging on those cards could give us a lead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unfortunately … cards are a bust. I ran the numbers. No recent activity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did we ever find those cards?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not in his hospital locker or his apartment or on his body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe the killer took them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I’ll have Tory monitor the numbers, see if any activity pops.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I got a lead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we’re really thinking this killer’s not Christopher Carlucci, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Oh, come on. The guy is guilty. Nobody thought otherwise until Castle over here started moonlighting for the mob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think that might be overstating it a little.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You took a blood oath. You let them turn you into an honorary mobster. What’s wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, come on, man. How many people, outside the mafia, ever get to swear omertà? I think it is an experience of a lifetime.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Of course you would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Didn’t you say you had a lead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. The lab was able to identify the crystals that Lanie found on Eric’s sleeves. They’re made up of sodium ferrocyanide mixed with sodium chloride, which means –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s road salt. It hasn’t snowed in weeks. So why would Eric be, literally, up to his elbows in salt?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. But there are only four salt depots on the island and one of them happens to be within three blocks of our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The blue backpack.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We searched for it. We never found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s because just before Eric died he hid that bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The salt depot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Man, the places we go to follow a lead. But if it points to our killer, it’s worth it indeed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If that’s you trying to help me with my poem then it’s not working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right over here. This is where Eric gained access.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, is that the – – right there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The victim’s blue backpack. You were right. Eric must have stashed it here before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what was he trying to hide that he didn’t want anyone to find?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bloody clothes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With bullet holes.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Here’s what I can tell you. The guy who wore these clothes was about six feet, maybe 180, 200 pounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about those injuries?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Two shots to the back. Both bullets exited the front of his body. Based on where he was hit and the amount of blood, he probably didn’t survive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So did any stiffs come in with those kinds of wounds? Minus his clothes, of course.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, I already checked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell when he was shot?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Blood coagulation says it was within the last two days.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Eric missed work two days ago and his Hitch app showed that he went to that surgical suite in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe this was one of his mob patients.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wasn’t. At least not according to Dino. No recent gunshot wounds in the family and Eric hadn’t treated anyone in the past week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then Eric must have treated someone else. Someone not connected to the Carluccis. Could that mean that Eric operated on someone from another family?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he did, and said mobster is dead or missing, then perhaps Detective McBride has heard about it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Meantime I’ll run DNA to see if this blood matches anyone in the system.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks, Lane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Hey. So what’s the game plan to survive dinner with your parents?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t know! We barely survived five minutes with them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You don’t – What if they ask us where we want to live? When we want kids? They’re going to see right through us. Maybe we should come clean.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi, I can’t come clean. If I come clean I will never hear the end of this. Look, you met them. You kept your promise. You can skip dinner. I’ll say something came up, like a dead body.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No way. I can’t be the kind of fiancé that bails on the one time your parents were in town. I have to go. We’re engaged.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We’re not engaged.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But we could be. Someday. And I don’t want them to hate me then because I skipped out now.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: So I asked around about the other crime families, looked into who might’ve gone missing or taken a bullet the last few days. I think I got your guy. Six one, a hundred ninety pounds. He’d fit into those clothes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Luca Tessaro? Of the Tessaro crime family?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Yeah. And the family’s beating the drums because Luca disappeared three days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aren’t the Tessaros and the Carluccis rivals?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: More like sworn enemies. Which could be why things went bad for your doctor. You don’t cross family lines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about Luca’s disappearance?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Well, three nights ago 911 got reports of shots fired near his neighborhood. Officers responded. They didn’t find anything, but Luca hasn’t been seen since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Whatever you need.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Eric treat Luca Tessaro, a member of a rival family?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, this is the beauty of me being mobbed up. Temporarily. I can go straight the source and ask Dino.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, just … be careful. If Eric treated a Carlucci enemy then Dino had motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino is not going to ask me to investigate if it’s going to lead back to his doorstep. I shall return with answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The boys and I will check the area where those shots were fired. Maybe officers missed something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well if unis missed something I’m not finding it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All five 911 callers said they heard shots near this underpass, so if Luca Tessaro was killed here there’s got to be evidence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Assuming he’s really our victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, he definitely is. Lanie just texted. Luca Tessaro’s in the system and the prelim DNA markers on the bloody clothes are a match.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now how did Luca and Eric cross paths in the first place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? I found a slug. Call CSU.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I found something else. Check this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rocco, you must be privy to the inner workings of the family. Do you mind if I ask you a few questions?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to go ahead and take that as a – as a yes, so … first of all, how well did you know Eric Mercer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a man of few words, Rocco. Very, very few words. How about Luca Tessaro? Eric have any history with him?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Luca’s a sore subject.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, sore subject why? Because he’s a Tessaro?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Because he’s a stain upon this family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I take it Eric didn’t like him?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Eric hated Luca. We all did. For what he did to Jane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino’s daughter? How’s she involved?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: One night she’s at this club. Luca was there and he tried to have his way with her. Word got back to Dino. He was ready to kill Luca. Wanted to pull the trigger himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did he?

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Uh uh. Jane stopped him. She didn’t want a war between the families. Besides, she’s a woman that can take care of herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. I just got some very interesting news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, so did I. We found blood evidence at the scene where Luca was shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was Luca’s blood on a bracelet. CSU pulled a thumbprint off of it that matched a DMV record. For Jane Scarpella. She’s Dino’s daughter. Look, it’s possible that Jane killed Luca. She got Eric to help cover it up and then she killed him too. I just – I don’t know what her motive would be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. Then, let’s hear it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can’t. I gotta go. I’ll call you back and tell you later. I hope.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: The boss’ll see you now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: What news do you have for me, Rick? Who killed Eric?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: You come in here, to my house of business, and accuse my daughter of not one but two murders?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not accuse, so much as … perhaps she’s a person of interest.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: You think I don’t know what that means? You disappoint me, Rick. I came to you, I put my faith in you. I thought we had an understanding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We did. We do. Look, you’re the last –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Dino, what – what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I don’t tolerate liars, Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino! Hey. Hey, we’re family, remember?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: That’s right. You never disrespect family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who disrespects you? I respect you, Dino. I – I respect the hell out of you.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Dad, it looks like Mr. Castle has information on Eric’s killer. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Step out, Jane. I’m conducting business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dino, ask her. Ask her. You at least owe me that much. If she’s guilty you need to know, otherwise you can’t protect her.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Guilty? Guilty of what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Luca Tessaro’s murder. Police found your bracelet where he was shot.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Jane, you tell him. Tell him you weren’t there. Jane, you better tell him.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Tell him! Jane, tell him!

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Daddy, I’m sorry! I was. But I didn’t kill him. I was trying to save him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Save him?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Dad, Luca and I … we were in love.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: You were in what? After what he did to you?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: That story about him coming on to me? I made it up.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Made it up? What do you mean, you made it up?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What was I supposed to say? That I was in love with a Tessaro? If either family knew our secret we could never be together.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Daddy?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I’m processing this news.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jane, what happened that night?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Luca called me, gasping for breath. He’d been shot. By the time I got to him he was unconscious. Dying. He needed help, so I dragged him into my car. That’s probably how I lost my bracelet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you called Eric.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I didn’t know what else to do. Eric told me to meet him at the surgery room. He did everything in his power to save Luca, but … he couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Which explains Eric’s murder. If the Tessaros found out Eric was involved with Luca’s death they would have retaliated. What do they know, Jane?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Nothing. Eric got rid of the – the body and the clothes so nothing could lead them to our family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jane, did Luca tell you on the phone who shot him? Who wanted him dead?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No, but last week he said something was up with the Tessaros. Someone was making a power grab and he was trying to find out who.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I swear. If the Tessaros killed my Eric we’re going to war.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lovers from rival families. Wow. That sounds like Romeo and Juliet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right down to Eric as the apothecary.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Jane’s alibi checks out. Doorman places her at home during Eric’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the street cams in the area around Luca Tessaro’s shooting?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We looked. There’s no cameras out that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we’re dead in the water.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means I could be dead in the water. If one of the Tessaros killed Luca and Eric we need to figure out who it was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, unless you’ve got a bud in that family too they’re not going to talk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Luckily a credit card just did the talking. Do you remember those hot numbers that Eric got from Rita? Well, someone just used one of them to order a pizza for delivery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the killer. He must have got the cards off Eric’s body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Delivery to where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: To a tile import business owned by Luca’s cousin, Dante Tessaro. And with Luca out of the way Dante becomes heir apparent to the Tessaro family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This tile business, what’s the address?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is it.

utterance.speaker: LUCA TESSARO
utterance.content: One more step and I’ll blow your heads off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Luca Tessaro? You’re alive?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Luca, put your weapon down.

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: Why? So you can take me out? Finish the job? Who sent you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nobody sent us, Mr. Tessaro. We’re not here to kill you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. As a matter of fact, we thought you were already dead. Look, if you don’t believe us – – you can always ask Jane. Isn’t that right, Jane?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Wait! It’s okay, Luca. They can help.

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: We knew our families would never approve of what we had. So we were going to use the opportunity to leave the life. For good. Disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those credit cards that Eric got. They were to help you get away?

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: But when Eric got popped, I figured it was the same guy that shot me. Maybe he found out I was alive and went after Eric to get to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was trying to kill you, Luca?

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: I didn’t see him. No one ever has, but he calls himself El Penumbra.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you know about him?

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: He’s a new player who showed up a few months ago. He started hitting up store owners on our turf for protection payments.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, the store owners must know who he is.

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: He was reaching out to them anonymously. Through email. Wire the payment or face consequences. One of our dry cleaners refused to pay. His store burnt down to the ground.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The mafia 2.0.

utterance.speaker: LUCA
utterance.content: Whoever this guy is, he was moving into our territory and the family ordered me to track him down. I uncovered the account where the shopkeepers were wiring him money. The next thing I know I get a call from some guy saying he could help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He tells you to meet him under the bridge but it’s a setup.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The shopkeepers we talked to confirmed Luca’s story. This El Penumbra’s been terrorizing them for months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you track someone nobody’s seen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not through that bank info that Luca uncovered. It dead-ended at a private account in the Cayman islands.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And given international banking laws there’s no way to determine who owns that account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe there is. I … uh… made a new friend that might help us skirt those pesky international banking laws.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, Rita, I know this is a big ask, but if we can figure out who owns that account we’ll find Eric’s real killer.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Now is this Penumbra character the same guy that framed Christopher?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We believe so, yes.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: All right, fine. I’ll help. But only because I don’t want to sleep alone on Christmas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and Christopher?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Okay … and. … you’ve gotta be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not even a clever alias.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: You know … this guy might be using this alias to withdraw his cash, but I bet he created the account remotely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think you can trace the account back to the computer it originated from?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I think you should tell Christopher he’s sleeping over New Year’s Eve, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Rita determined El Penumbra’s Cayman account was opened using a server at the Midtown Library branch.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A public terminal. Makes sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Especially since most libraries don’t have security cameras.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the convenience store across the street from this one does, so we pulled the video feed from the same day that El Penumbra created the account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: it’s time stamped so … … there. That’s the only person who leaves in the minutes after the account was opened. Well, hello bad Santa.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for coming to see us, Detective.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our investigation uncovered something that we hope the organized crime might have information about.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Uh … what’d you find.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Luca Tessaro. Alive.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: From the clothes that you told me about I assumed that he was dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He almost was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe the person that shot Luca also killed Eric Mercer to cover their tracks, which means the shooter knew that the two of them were in contact.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The shooter goes by the name El Penumbra. Does that ring a bell?

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: I can’t say it does.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Well, this El Penumbra, he planted evidence to frame Christopher Carlucci of Eric’s murder after using a Mustang like Christopher’s to commit the crime.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: I’m not sure where you’re going with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your neighbor owns a black Mustang. He said that you slipped him a little cash to borrow it for that night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We had CSU sweep the car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They found traces of Eric’s blood on the floor mat, left there by your boot.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: Are you accusing me of murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Along with the attempted murder of Luca Tessaro and felony extortion. We found the account in the Caymans. You’ve been working OCU for sixteen years watching bad guys get rich.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you decided to play both sides and get a little piece of the action.

utterance.speaker: MCBRIDE
utterance.content: This’ll never fly in court.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well. There’s only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Rick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHRISTOPHER
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. I’m very grateful. And so is Rita.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: And my daughter, Jane. She thanks you, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going to happen to her and Luca?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: I decided it’s better to bless her relationship and unite with the Tessaros than to lose my kid. Tis the season of peace, huh?

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Rick, you did me a favor. I owe you. When the time comes, you call me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you very much. That’s a call I hope I never have to make.

utterance.speaker: DINO
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: Dinner was so great. We can’t wait to see you two lovebirds again. Maybe next time we can talk about the wedding.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe. One step at a time, Mom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was great to finally meet you both.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: All right, pumpkin.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Bye, mommy.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: Love you. You be good.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: MELINDA
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You guys have a good trip.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Thank you for that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, it was actually much easier than I thought it was going to be.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But … you know, it made me think seriously about us. And where we are.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi, I don’t think we should do this here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I have to say this. Lanie, being fake engaged to you made me realize how great we are together. But not the way that your parents are. Or Castle and Beckett, or Ryan and Jenny.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know. I feel it too. I mean, I’m crazy about you –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, I’m crazy about you, too. But just – you know, not … not in that way. And you deserve what they have.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We both do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you going to tell your parents?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The truth. But after the holidays. No need to spoil their vacation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So they cut you with a little ceremonial dagger. Did it hurt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it hurt. But you can’t let him know that, right? So my face was life a stone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A black hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Can I have a word, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. Here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell me the rest later. Who wants nog?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there a problem, Captain?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: As he was being transferred to Central Booking, Detective McBride was shot and killed by unknown assailants. The DA learned that you were cooperating with members of organized crime in your investigation. People that might have wanted McBride dead. This doesn’t look good. Especially for you. I am so sorry, Mr. Castle, but the DA spoke to the mayor and – – you are no longer permitted to work with the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Hey. Okay, so I um … I got my draft of the poem for the family Christmas card. Do you want to hear it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. This has been an epic year. Life’s been full of joy and tears. Solving crimes and catching killers, just like Castle’s famous thrillers. We share our passion every day. As partners go we’re here to stay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Is something wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What could be wrong? You’re here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, everybody. Let’s light this baby up!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It looks great this year.
